tuv.seg: How to make a consumer complaint
Conas gearán tomhaltóra a dhéanamh
When you buy goods or services in Ireland or another EU Member State you will have certain rights under consumer legislation
Nuair a cheannaíonn tú earraí nó seirbhísí in Éirinn nó i mBallstát eile de chuid an AE, bíonn cearta áirithe agat faoin reachtaíocht tomhaltóirí
It can be difficult sometimes to know where to complain or to whom you should address your complaint
Bíonn sé deacair ar uairibh fios a bheith ag duine faoin áit chun gearán a thabhairt nó faoin té ar chóir duit do ghearán a thabhairt faoina mbráid
There are a number of consumer organisations in Ireland and throughout the EU that provide advice on your rights
Tá roinnt eagras tomhaltóirí ann in Éirinn agus ar fud an AE a sholáthraíonn comhairle faoi do chearta
In the interests of good customer service the majority of businesses will be pleased to set any matter right
Bíonn móramh na ngnólachtaí sásta aon ní a dheasú, ar mhaithe le dea-sheirbhís tomhaltóirí
Know what your rights are
Bíodh do chearta ar eolas agat
Before you make a complaint be aware of your consumer rights under the law
Bíodh do chearta ar eolas agat sula ndéanann tú gearán
If you have a written contract or description of the goods or services read what it states
Má tá conradh scríofa nó tuairisc de na hearraí nó seirbhísí agat, léigh an méid a mhaítear ann
Your complaint will almost certainly be much more effective if you are aware of your rights
Is dóichí go mb’éifeachtaí do ghearánsa más feasach duit faoi do chearta
Remember: A repair, a replacement or a refund are all possible options where goods are faulty
Cuimhnigh: Is roghanna féideartha iad deisiú, athchur nó aisíoc nuair a bhíonn earraí lochtach
Deal with the issue as soon as possible
Téigh i ngleic leis an scéal chomh luath agus is féidir
If a product is defective it is important that you return it as soon as possible after you notice the fault
Má tá táirge lochtach, tá sé tábhachtach go seolfá ar ais é chomh luath agus is féidir tar éis duit an locht a thabhairt faoi deara
If you keep a faulty item for a long time, you may be considered to have accepted the item in that state
Má choimeádann tú mír lochtach ar feadh i bhfad, d’fhéadfaí go measfaí fút gur ghlac tú leis an mír sa riocht sin

The situation is similar for services that you are unhappy with. In some cases, there are time limits for taking certain procedures (for example, if you have a complaint about a package holiday you need to complain to the tour operator within 28 days of returning from the holiday)

Ba chóir go mb’fheasach duit freisin go mbíonn teorainneacha ama do thógáil nósanna imeachta áirithe (mar shampla, má theastaíonn uait gearán a dhéanamh faoi ghlao seirbhíse préimhráta beidh ort gearán a thabhairt chuig ComReg laistigh de 3 mhí ó dháta an ghlao)
Even where there are no time limits set down, it is easier for you and the organisation to deal with recent events
Fiú sa chás nach leagtar síos aon teorainneacha ama, is fusa duitse agus don eagras chun plé le heachtraí déanacha
Find and keep all relevant documents
Faigh agus coinnigh gach cáipéis ábhartha
It is important to keep any documents relating to your complaint
Bíonn sé tábhachtach aon cháipéisí a choinneáil i ndáil le do ghearánsa
You may need these records later if you take your complaint to another authority to solve it
D’fhéadfaí go dteastódh na taifid sin uait ní ba dhéanaí má chaitheann tú do ghearánsa a thabhairt chuig údarás eile lena réiteach
It is also useful to keep track of the steps you took to address this complaint
Bíonn sé úsáideach freisin súil a choinneáil ar na céimeanna a ghlac tú chun aghaidh a thabhairt ar an ngearán seo
That means keeping receipts or cheque-stubs as proof of purchase for the products or services
Is éard is brí leis an méid sin ná admhálacha nó comhdhuillí seice a choinneáil mar chruthúnas ceannaigh do na táirgí nó seirbhísí
If you are complaining by telephone, make sure you record details of the calls
Má bhíonn tú ag déanamh gearáin ar ghuthán, déan cinnte de go ndéanann tú taifead ar mhionsonraí na nglaonna
That is, keeping track of whom you spoke to, what was agreed, etc
Is é sin, taifead a choimeád de na daoine ar labhair tú leo, an méid a n-aontaíodh air, srl
If your complaint is in writing, keep records of what you write, send photocopies of receipts and keep originals
Más i scríbhinn atá do ghearánsa, coinnigh taifid faoin méid a scríobhann tú, seol fótachóipeanna d’admhálacha agus coinnigh na bunchóipeanna díobh
It is your responsibility to prove that you bought the goods or services that you are complaining about
Is í d’fhreagracht í a chruthú gur cheannaigh tú na hearraí nó na seirbhísí a bhfuil tú ag gearán fúthu
A receipt is just one way to prove that you bought an item or paid for a service
Is bealach amháin é admháil chun a chruthú gur cheannaigh tú mír nó gur íoc tú as seirbhís
If you paid for the item by credit card, you could use your credit card statement as proof of purchase
Má íoc tú as mír trí chárta creidmheasa, d’fhéadfá do ráiteas chárta creidmheasa a úsáid mar chruthúnas ceannaigh
A cheque stub can also be used as proof of purchase
Is féidir comhdhuille seice a úsáid freisin mar chruthúnas ceannaigh
If you do pay for an item in cash, ask for a receipt and keep it safe
Má íocann tú as mír le hairgead tirim, iarr ar admháil agus coinnigh sábháilte í
A receipt issued following a cash transaction is your only record that you have bought an item
Is í an t-aon taifead amháin gur cheannaigh tú mír í an admháil a eisíodh tar éis idirbheartú airgid thirim
Start at the least formal level
Tosaigh ag an leibhéal is lú foirmiúlachta
You should begin by making your complaint informally
Ba cheart duit tosú le do ghearánsa a dhéanamh go neamhfhoirmiúil
This means giving the retailer or service provider the first opportunity to solve the problem
Ciallaíonn sé seo go dtugtar deis ar dtús don miondíoltóir nó don soláthraí seirbhíse an fhadhb a réiteach
It is advisable to speak to a 'decision-maker' such as a supervisor or a manager who may have the authority to give you a refund or replacement
Moltar duit labhairt le ‘cinnteoir’ ar nós forbhreathnóra nó bainisteora a bhféadfadh an t-údarás a bheith acu chun aisíoc nó ionadaí a thabhairt chugat
If informal contact with the business doesn't work you should next put your complaint in writing
Mura n-oibríonn teagmháil neamhfhoirmiúil leis an ngnólacht ba cheart duit do ghearánsa a chur i scríbhinn mar an chéad chéim eile
It may be useful to check in advance if the business has a specific customer complaint form for you to fill in
B’fhéidir go mb’áisiúil duitse seiceáil roimhré an bhfuil foirm shonrach um ghearán tomhaltóra le do comhlíonadh ag gnólacht
When you put your complaint in writing, remember to be clear and state all the facts of the case
Nuair a chuireann tú do ghearánsa i scríbhinn, meabhraigh a bheith soiléir agus tabhair gach fíric den chás
Remain objective and avoid giving personal opinion, or comments
Fan oibiachtúil agus seachain an tuairimíocht phearsanta nó moltaí a thabhairt, d’fhéadfá an litir shamplach seo a bhrath mar áis
If direct contact with the company does not work to your satisfaction, you should then complain to the appropriate complaints body if there is one
Mura n-oibríonn an teagmháil dhíreach leis an gcomhlacht chun do shásaimhse, ba chóir duit gearán a dhéanamh ansin chuig an gcomhlacht iomchuí gearán más ann do cheann éigin mar sin. Is fusa i
Escalating a matter is considerably easier when you have exhausted less formal routes
bhfad ábhar a fhormhéadú nuair a bhíonn bealaí níos neamhfhoirmiúla ídithe agat
You may also find that many consumer organisations cannot help with a problem if you have already taken the case to a solicitor
B’fhéidir go bhfaighfeá amach nach féidir le go leor eagras tomhaltóirí cabhrú le fadhb má thóg tú an cás chuig dlíodóir
Exhausting less formal routes also demonstrates that you took all reasonable steps to redress your complaint before complaining formally
Léirítear le hídiú na mbealaí níos neamhfhoirmiúla freisin gur ghlac tú le gach céim réasúnach chun do ghearán a shásamh sula ndéanann tú gearán go foirmiúil
It also demonstrates that the retailer had a number of opportunities to put matters right before you chose to escalate them
Léirítear leis freisin go raibh roinnt deiseanna ag an miondíoltóir nithe a dheasú sula roghnaíonn tú cúrsaí a mhéadú
If you buy faulty goods and you complain successfully to the retailer you are entitled to a replacement, a repair or a refund
Má cheannaíonn tú earraí lochtacha agus má dhéanann tú gearán rathúil leis an miondíoltóir tá tú i dteideal ceann nua, deisiúchán nó aisíocaíocht a fháil
The Sale of Goods and Supply of Services Act, 1980 does not state how a refund should be made
Ní mhaíonn An tAcht um Dhíol Earraí agus Soláthar Seirbhísí, 1980 conas go ndéanfaí aisíocaíocht
The retailer or supplier of services can give a refund in cash, cheque or a refund to a credit card account
Féadann an miondíoltóir nó an soláthraí seirbhísí aisíoc in airgead tirim, seic nó aisíoc chuig cuntas chárta creidmheasa a thabhairt
The retailer could also issue a credit note
D’fhéadfadh an miondíoltóir nóta sochair a eisiúint freisin
Remember: A repair, a replacement or a refund are all possible options where goods are faulty
• Is nóta páipéir é nóta sochair a eisíonn an miondíoltóir chuig custaiméir nuair a thugtar earraí ar ais
Read more about Refunds, Credit notes and Vouchers here
Ní bhíonn aon cheart agat má chailltear dearbhán
If you are still unhappy after you have complained to the retailer or service provider, you may need to go to a complaints body
Má tá tú fós míshásta tar éis duit do ghearán a thabhairt chuig an miondíoltóir nó an soláthraí seirbhíse, b’fhéidir go dteastódh uait a dhul chuig comhlacht gearán
In some areas, there is no specific body to deal with your complaint and your only recourse is to the Courts, particularly the Small Claims Court
I roinnt cúinsí, ní bhíonn comhlacht áirithe ann chun plé le do ghearánsa agus gurb iad na Cúirteanna an t-aon iontaoibh agat, go háirithe Cúirt na nÉileamh Beag
There are a number of consumer complaints bodies in Ireland and abroad that protect your rights
Tá roinnt comhlachtaí gearán tomhaltóirí ann in Éirinn agus thar lear chun cosaint a thabhairt do do chearta
Some of these bodies are based in law, others are regulated by the industry, others are voluntary organisations
Bíonn roinnt de na comhlachtaí seo bunaithe sa dlí, is é an lucht tionscail a rialaíonn cinn eile, agus is eagrais deonacha cuid eile fós
Some consumer complaints bodies have the power to prosecute offenders, others have the power to make recommendations or non-binding directions
Bíonn de chumhacht ag roinnt comhlachtaí gearán tomhaltóirí chun ciontóirí a ionchúiseamh, bíonn cumhacht ag cinn eile moltaí nó treoruithe neamhcheangailteacha a dhéanamh
If you are unsure of your rights, get help from the various information sources listed in consumer protection organisations
Má bhíonn tú neamhchinnte i dtaobh do chearta, faigh cúnamh ó na foinsí éagsúla eolais a liostaítear sna heagrais chosanta tomhaltóirí
An Alternative Dispute Resolution Body may also be able to help you
D’fhéadfaí go mbeadh Comhlacht Malartach um Réiteach Díospóidí ar oscailt duit freisin
In some cases, there is no relevant complaints body and you may then have to consider taking a case to the Small Claims Court
I roinnt cásanna, ní bhíonn aon chomhlacht gearán ábhartha ann agus b’fhéidir go gcaithfeá smaoineamh ansin faoi chás a thabhairt chuig Cúirt na nÉileamh Beag
If you have bought on hire purchase (HP) or under a consumer hire agreement
Má cheannaigh tú ar FC nó faoi chomhaontú cíosa do thomhaltóir
Anything you buy under a hire purchase (HP) or a consumer hire agreement must be of merchantable quality, as described and fit for its purpose
Ní mór d’aon ní a cheannaíonn tú faoi chomhaontú fruilcheannaigh nó comhaontú cíosa tomhaltóra a bheith de cháilíocht indíolta, mar a thuairiscítear é agus feiliúnach dá chuspóir
In other words, consumer rights in this situation are the same as as if the goods were purchased outright
I bhfocail eile, is ionann cearta tomhaltóirí sa chúinse sin agus mar a bheadh amhail is gur ceannaíodh na hearraí ina n-iomláine
If you are dissatisfied with goods received under a consumer hire agreement, you should make your complaint to the retailer who sold you the goods
Má bhíonn tú míshásta le hearraí a fuarthas faoi chomhaontú cíosa tomhaltóra, ba chóir duit do ghearánsa a dhéanamh don miondíoltóir a dhíol na hearraí leat
You may also be able to make a complaint to the finance company
D’fhéadfaí go mbeifeá in ann gearán a dhéanamh chuig an gcomhlacht airgeadais
If you are unhappy with the retailer's response, you should contact the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (CCPC)
Má bhíonn tú míshásta le freagra miondíoltóra, ba cheart duit dul i dteagmháil leis an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí
The Central Bank of Ireland is responsible for the regulation of credit institutions and has implemented a Code of Conduct for credit institutions
Tá freagracht ag an Bhainc Ceannais na hÉireann as rialú na bhforas creidmheasa agus tá Cóid Chleachtais forbartha acu d’fhorais chreidmheasa
Consumer complaints in the EU
Gearáin Tomhaltóirí san AE
European legislation protects you every time you shop in Ireland or in another EU Member State
Tugann reachtaíocht na hEorpa cosaint duit gach uair a dhéanann tú siopadóireacht in Éirinn nó i mBallstát eile den AE
Consumers can benefit by availing of cheaper prices and better selection of items that the single market provides
Is féidir le tomhaltóirí a leas a bhaint trí phraghsanna níos saoire agus rogha níos fearr míreanna a fháil, mar a sholáthraíonn an margadh aonair
Consumer problems that arise when you shop across borders are often more difficult to resolve than problems with local suppliers
Is minic na fadhbanna tomhaltóra a ardaítear nuair a dhéanann tú siopadóireacht trasteorann níos deacra lena réiteach ná fadhbanna le soláthróirí áitiúla
Language differences and distance make it more difficult to complain effectively
Bíonn sé níos deacra le difríochtaí teanga agus an fad ó bhaile gearán éifeachtach a dhéanamh
The European Consumer Centre (ECC) in Ireland is there to support you if you have a problem with a supplier of goods or services in another EU Member State
Tá an Lárionad Eorpach do Thomhaltóirí (ECC) ann chun tacú leat má bhíonn fadhb agat le soláthróir earraí nó seirbhísí i mBallstát éigin eile den AE
ECC Ireland provides a free information and advice service on consumer rights in the EU
Soláthraíonn an ECC Éire seirbhís shaor in aisce um fhaisnéis agus cearta na dtomhaltóirí san AE
It is part of an EU wide network of consumer centres and it can help you to solve consumer disputes arising in other member states of the EU
Is cuid de líonra lárionaid tomhaltóirí ar fud an AE é agus is féidir leis cabhrú leat aighnis tomhaltóra a éiríonn anuas i mBallstáit eile den AE a réiteach
It does this by trying to solve the dispute directly with the provider of goods or services and, if this fails, by referring your case to an alternative dispute resolution body

Déanann sé é seo trí iarracht a dhéanamh an t-aighneas a réiteach go díreach le soláthróir na n-earraí nó na seirbhísí, agus má theipeann air sin, trí do chás a tharchur ar aghaidh chuig comhlacht malartach um réiteach díospóidí
